original_title: Sri Lanka’s less complex divestitures to be wrapped up in 2023
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Less complex entities listed for divestiture are expected to be wrapped up in 2023 and the balance by the first quarter of 2024, Sri Lanka’s state enterprise reform unit chief Suresh Shah said.
Transaction advisors are being appointed to provide sell-side due diligence to the state entities listed for divestiture.
The International Finance Corporation has also made a proposal after being invited to advise on SriLankan Airlines, Sri Lanka Telecom and Lanka Hospitals.

The cabinet of ministers had initially directed the SRU to also divest Hotel Developers Lanka (Hilton), Sri Lanka Insurance, Litro Gas Lanka/Litro Gas Terminals and Canwill Holdings which owns the partially build Grand Hyatt Building.

Sell side due diligence needs to be “as comprehensive as a buy side due diligence, and should be sufficiently comprehensive to ensure that the buyer does not impose any conditionalities and warranties pertaining to the final transaction,” according to guidance provided to prospective transaction advisors.
A data room will be set up which could be accessed by prospective bidders, under non-disclosure agreements, Shah said.
At the moment parties making inquiries about firms are directed to publicly available information.
All divestitures will be advertised to draw competitive bids. (Colombo/May14/2023)
